DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to compare the efficacy of haloperidol and valproate in management of people with agitation in emergency department
DOC.criteria: Clinical diagnosis of psychomotor agitation aged 18 to 65 years Pregnant patients Severe liver disease History of drug (haloperidol/valproate) allergy Readily amendable causes for the agitation (hypoxemia or hypoglycemia) Hypotension (systolic blood pressure (SBP) â‰¤ 90 mm Hg) Known history of liver disease or uncontrolled diabetes Noticeable or suspected head trauma Previous history of neuroleptic malignant syndrome Receiving psychotropic medication, neuroleptic agents or cholinesterase inhibitors at the time of enrollment
